intro: Willugbaeya, commonly known as the New Zealand broom, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its erect, spiny stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is adapted to the temperate climate of New Zealand and thrives in well-drained soils. Willugbaeya has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces pods that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it has been introduced to other regions but is considered invasive in some areas.
